properties.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 12 at 1:49PM CST until February 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
properties.description:
...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS IN WESTERN MINNESOTA THROUGH 6 PM...

...DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY
MORNING...

.A Blizzard Warning remains in effect for portions of west
central and southwest Minnesota through the afternoon. A Winter
Weather Advisory continues east of the Blizzard Warning for
blowing snow and possible near-blizzard conditions at times, as
well as the potential for flash freezing roadways and surfaces as
temperatures plummet this afternoon behind an Arctic front. Wind
Chill Warnings remain in effect for west central through
southwestern Minnesota, and have been extended farther east into
central and south-central Minnesota. Wind Chill Advisories remain
in place for east central Minnesota, southeast Minnesota and west-
central Wisconsin Wednesday night into Thursday morning.

Widespread blowing snow, with whiteout conditions, continues
across west central and southwest Minnesota, mainly west of a
Morris to Redwood Falls to St. James line. East of this area,
winds will remain high, but visibilities are not expected to drop
to blizzard criteria, but areas of blowing snow will continue.

Plummeting temperatures this afternoon and evening may lead to
flash freezing of this light snow on roadways and surfaces, with
impacts to the evening commute expected.

Temperatures will continue to drop off sharply behind the Arctic
front. Wind chill values will average 25 to 35 degrees below zero
over west central Minnesota, with wind chills of 35 to 40 degrees
below zero likely by the evening. These dangerous wind chills will
continue into mid-morning Thursday. In eastern Minnesota, into
western Wisconsin, wind chills will drop to between 25 and 35
degrees below zero late tonight, and through Thursday morning.

...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO
10 AM CST THURSDAY...

* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter
Weather Advisory, areas of blowing snow. Winds gusting as high
as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Douglas and Pope Counties.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to
10 AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3
PM CST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow will significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold
wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little
as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you
wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON
